Comment: Bare Stem Pre-Nominals: Adpositions 1:6  John saw the brick house.  Joshua 8:22:5  ... the two groups of Israelite soldiers.   All of these NPs must be immediately before the head noun, so I set the embedded NP to Bare Stem Prenominal Modifier.  But that causes problems in verses like Ex. 9:10 the skin of the Egyptian people, so I removed Bare Stem Prenominal Modifier.-*-  Norman Genitive:  Adpositions 1:8  John saw the people of Egypt. With Norman Genitives, don't set the possessed noun's Participant Tracking to Generic.  Adpositions 1:18  John cut the roots of the tree.-*-  Quantity-Singular without a Cardinal Number: Luke 6:41  Do not look at a small piece of wood ...  Set the Adposition's Position Feature to End of Phrase so that it will be positioned at the end of the Quantity NP.-*-  Set the Adposition's Position Feature to End of Phrase so that it will be positioned at the end of the Quantity NP.-*-  Gen. 32:10 I have two groups of people, and two groups of animals.-*-  Gen. 29:2  Three flocks of sheep were ...-*-  Gen. 29:2  Three herds of cows were ...-*-  Exodus 8:24 swarms of flies-*-  I've turned this structure off.  A 'group of people' is different than a 'crowd of people'.  Jesus told the people to sit down in groups of 50 people.  Mark 8:34  the crowd of people -*-  Genesis 31:51  a pile of stones-*-  If there's a possessive NP modifying the same noun as a Group NP, move the possessive NP into the Group NP.  Genesis 18:7  Abraham ran to his herd of cows.-*-  Quantity-Plural: Ruth 2:17 Ruth had eighteen liters of grain.  Set the Adposition's Position Feature to End of Phrase so that it will be positioned at the end of the Quantity NP.-*-  Quantity: Adpositions 1:19  John saw one liter of wheat.  Set the Adposition's Position Feature to End of Phrase so that it will be positioned at the end of the Quantity NP. The following comments are old and incorrect: Copy the Proximity feature from the head noun to the quantity noun as in Avian Influenza 2:9  Take these gloves and THIS jar of bleach ...  'bleach' is Near Speaker, but 'jar' is Not Applicable for Proximity.  Set the head noun to Singular and Generic.  1 Samuel 17:17  Take these 36 pounds of grain to your brothers.-*-  Name:  Ephesians 1:15 You're trusting in the Lord Jesus.  -*-  Name:  Philipians 2:8 Jesus obeyed God the Father.-*-  This structure is turned off because it's now handled in a Restructuring rule.
